column4: I have a user ABC which can SSH into ubuntu 10.04 lts with username/login and then change the session to root by using su.

Now I established an OpenSSH connection with key authenticication and I can't use su anymore to switch over to root session. Is that a config of OpenSSH? I don't want the user ABC to have sudo rights.
Please don't flood; use http://paste.ubuntu.com to paste; don't use Enter as punctuation.
